references.paper_title: Finite-time analysis of the multiarmed bandit problem
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational finite-time analysis for the multi-armed bandit problem, a core concept underlying the structured bandit algorithms used in the current research.
This paper expands the foundational multi-armed bandit analysis to the non-stochastic setting, relevant because of privacy constraints in online auctions.

references.paper_title: Unimodal bandits: Regret lower bounds and optimal algorithms
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of unimodal bandits, a specific type of structured bandit problem relevant to the current research due to the unimodal property of the expected reward function.

references.paper_title: Analysis of Thompson sampling for the multi-armed bandit problem
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive analysis of Thompson sampling, another important algorithm for multi-armed bandit problems, which can be compared and contrasted to the algorithms proposed in this research.

references.paper_title: Improved algorithms for linear stochastic bandits
references.reason: This paper offers improved algorithms for linear stochastic bandits, which are relevant because the methods presented build upon existing structured bandit algorithms.
